intro: Brassica oleracea var. hongnoensis, commonly known as the Korean kale or Chinese kale, is a variety of cabbage characterized by its thick, dark green leaves. It is native to East Asia and is cultivated for its edible leaves and stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a rosette growth pattern. Its leaves are often used in Asian cuisine for their mild, slightly bitter flavor. Botanically, it belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is closely related to other cruciferous vegetables.
